definitions.definition: to begin to exist or to make something begin to exist:
examples: A crowd formed around the accident.

definitions.definition: to make something into a particular shape:
examples: She formed the clay into a small bowl.
The lorries formed a barricade across the road.

definitions.definition: If separate things form, they come together to make a whole:
a paper or set of papers printed with spaces in which answers to questions can be written or information can be recorded in an organized way:
examples: an application form (= document used for asking officially for something, for example a job)
